questionText: What is the purpose of the borrow module in IOTA?

answerOptions.answerText: To provide mutable references to objects
To simulate object references in programmable transaction blocks (PTBs)
To wrap objects and make them immutable

questionText: What does a mutable reference allow you to do with an object?

answerOptions.answerText: Alter the object but not destroy or transfer it
Wrap the object with the store ability

questionText: Why is the 'Borrow' object essential in the borrow module?

answerOptions.answerText: It allows references to be saved for future transactions
It ensures that the object retrieved by value is the same as the original
It prevents objects from being destroyed or transferred
It allows retrieval of multiple objects simultaneously

questionText: What is the primary limitation of PTBs regarding references?

answerOptions.answerText: PTBs do not allow object references returned from one command to be used in another
PTBs can only work with objects by value
PTBs do not support mutable references
PTBs cannot work with objects at all
